title: BTS fans donate blood in Korea to celebrate Jimin's 24th birthday
text:
More than 600 BTS fans donate blood for Jimin’s 24th birthday (Picture: Getty)

At least 600 BTS fans have donated blood to celebrate the 24th birthday of lead vocalist Jimin.

Is there a more iconic fanbase?

According to All K-Pop, the Army started going to blood drives in their droves in the month leading up to the singer’s birthday on 13 October.

More than 710 fans visited the Central Seoul Blood Bank, Busan Blood Bank and Southwest Seoul Blood Bank over the last month, but almost 100 were turned away for not meeting the qualifications to donate blood.

But this final number doesn’t include the many fans all over the world who donated blood but were not counted in this South Korean tally.

Fans also reportedly donated around 2,000 gifts to doctors on behalf of Jimin.

Mad respect.

Fans of BTS’ Jimin donated blood in honour of his birthday (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

The South Korean Red Cross then announced they are going to give Jimin an Award of Appreciation for inspiring his fans to donate to a charitable cause.

‘We’re grateful for BTS Jimin’s fans who helped save lives by donating their blood,’ the Korean Red Cross reportedly announced. ‘We’ll be giving Jimin an award of appreciation for making the blood drive more known and for inspiring more people to take part in good charity work.’

It’s not the only thing the Army managed to accomplish for their idols’ birthday.

Fans got a whole host of hashtags trending worldwide, such as ‘#HappyBirthdayJimin’ and ‘#JiminBirthday’.

Meanwhile, BTS’ official Twitter account has shared some adorable snaps of the star to wish him a happy birthday as the members shared their own messages for him.

Fans are assuming that Suga brought the shade with one message urging the star to ‘grow tall this year’, while another post read: ‘Happy birthday to our pretty Jimin. Let’s eat delicious food in Korea.’

And another shared sweet images of him in front of a lake with the caption: ‘Happy Birthday Mr. Ji-Min’.
